intro: Streptanthus hyacinthoides, commonly known as the hyacinth-flowered wintercress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats and has a mat-forming growth pattern. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are usually purple or blue, resembling those of the hyacinth. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
